result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David Allen Defoe

records.addlTxt:
11:04 AM Defendant David Allen Defoe appeared by video, in custody from ACJ.  Attorney Kenneth W. Ryder III appeared by video for David Allen Defoe.  Attorney Lynne K Van Hollen appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Atty, def has recv'd copy of complaint, waives reading, waives right to prelim hearing.  Def discussed with Atty, understands rights giving up.  Atty is satisfied.  Court is satisfied and accepts waiver.  Court has reviewed complaint and finds PC that def has committed a felony in Ashland County.  Case is bound over for arraignment.  State filing information now, contains the same charges.  Atty, recv'd copy of information, pleads NG, noted.
Status conference scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on November 14, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Email sent to ACJ advising def has court on Sept 12;  ka

Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 12, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on August 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:03 AM - Prosecuting attorney David V. Meany appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant David Allen Defoe appeared by video (fr ACJ). Waiting for Atty for def, SPD is looking.  Ct adj's 1 more time & if none found, ct will appt.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Email sent to ACJ advising def has court on Aug 15;  ka

10:10 AM Defendant David Allen Defoe appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney David Meany appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. SPD is looking for an atty for the def.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Also has $5000 signature bond
Def shall not possess or consume any mind-altering substances meaning alcoholic beverages, controlled substances, inhalants, synthetic marijuana, or similar substances and/or over the counter medications used contrary to label instructions, or prescription medications not taken in compliance with a prescription issued to the defendant.  Def is not to go into any place where mind altering substances are present, maintained, sold or consumed, except defendant may enter a convenience store or grocery store, even if alcohol is sold there.

Also has Cash bond $500
Def shall not possess or consume any mind-altering substances meaning alcoholic beverages, controlled substances, inhalants, synthetic marijuana, or similar substances and/or over the counter medications used contrary to label instructions, or prescription medications not taken in compliance with a prescription issued to the defendant.  Def is not to go into any place where mind altering substances are present, maintained, sold or consumed, except defendant may enter a convenience store or grocery store, even if alcohol is sold there.
